benefits.title: The Health Benefits of Dietary Fibre
benefits.summary: Dietary fiber intake associates with overall metabolic health, improved cardiovascular disease, colonic health, gut motility, and reduced risk for colorectal carcinoma.

benefits.title: Health benefits of dietary fiber.
benefits.summary: High intakes of dietary fiber are associated with lower risk for coronary heart disease, stroke, hypertension, diabetes, obesity, and certain gastrointestinal diseases.

benefits.title: Microbiota-Generated Metabolites Promote Metabolic Benefits via Gut-Brain Neural Circuits
benefits.summary: Soluble dietary fibers promote metabolic benefits on body weight and glucose control by activating intestinal gluconeogenesis.

benefits.title: Fiber and Prebiotics: Mechanisms and Health Benefits
benefits.summary: Higher intakes of dietary fiber are linked to less cardiovascular disease, gut health, and lower body weights.

benefits.title: Effects of Dietary Fiber and Its Components on Metabolic Health
benefits.summary: Intake of dietary fiber and whole grains is inversely related to obesity, type two diabetes, cancer, and cardiovascular disease.

benefits.title: Composition, properties and health benefits of indigestible carbohydrate polymers as dietary fiber: a review.
benefits.summary: Fibers in daily diet prevent or reduce bowel disorders, decrease risk of coronary heart disease and type 2 diabetes.

benefits.title: The physiological roles of dietary fibre
benefits.summary: Dietary fiber affects gut processes, satiety, satiation, microfloral diversity/toxicity, innate immune responses, and may impact cardiovascular/systemic health.

benefits.title: Understanding the Physics of Functional Fibers in the Gastrointestinal Tract: An Evidence-Based Approach to Resolving Enduring Misconceptions about Insoluble and Soluble Fiber.
benefits.summary: High viscosity fibers like b-glucan, psyllium, and raw guar gum significantly lower cholesterol and improve glycemic control, while insoluble fibers like wheat bran can cause constipation.
benefits.journal: Journal of the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics

benefits.title: Influence of dietary fiber on inflammatory bowel disease and colon cancer: importance of fermentation pattern.
benefits.summary: Dietary fiber benefits include decreasing inflammation in inflammatory bowel disease and potentially preventing colon cancer due to its fermentative production of butyrate.

benefits.title: Prebiotics, Fermentable Dietary Fiber, and Health Claims.
benefits.summary: Dietary fiber has positive effects on health, potentially linked to increasing gastrointestinal microbiota numbers and activity.

side effects.title: Somatic and autonomic small fiber neuropathy induced by bortezomib therapy: an immunofluorescence study
side effects.summary: Bortezomib treatment can cause small fiber neuropathy, which can lead to autonomic symptoms like postural dizziness, syncope, diarrhea, ileus, impotence, and urinary disturbances.

side effects.title: Comparative effects of intraduodenal psyllium and senna on canine small bowel motility
side effects.summary: Bulking fibers like psyllium and senna may contribute to altered small intestinal motor activity as side effects.

side effects.title: Dietary Fiber in Health and Disease
side effects.summary: Side effects of a high fiber diet include gaseousness, bloating, diffuse abdominal pain, and diarrhea.

side effects.title: [Usefulness and side effects of a diet rich in vegetable fiber in insulin-dependent diabetic adolescents].
side effects.summary: A high fiber diet can improve metabolic control of type I diabetes, but side effects on intestinal absorption of oligo-elements are possible.

side effects.title: Impact of Soluble Fiber in the Microbiome and Outcomes in Critically Ill Patients
side effects.summary: Fiber supplementation in critically ill patients appears to be safe and may have beneficial effects in reducing diarrhea, infections, and length of stay.

side effects.title: A blend of acacia gum, fructan‐type fibers, and outer pea fiber exhibits lower gas production compared to other fiber blends in vitro
side effects.summary: Blend 1 of fermentable and nonfermentable fibers produced less gas and had higher pH values while achieving similar short chain fatty acid production as other blends.

side effects.title: Do fibre containing enteral diets have advantages over existing low residue diets?
side effects.summary: No difference was seen in frequency of bowel action, stool weight, or gastrointestinal side effects between fiber-containing and fiber-free enteral diets.

side effects.title: Effects of dietary fiber and phytic acid on mineral availability.
side effects.summary: Increasing dietary fiber in Western communities should not have any adverse effect on mineral absorption if combined with adequate intake of other food components.
side effects.journal: Critical reviews in food science and nutrition

side effects.title: Dietary fibre in food and protection against colorectal cancer in the European Prospective Investigation into Cancer and Nutrition (EPIC): an observational study
side effects.summary: A doubling of total fiber intake from foods could reduce the risk of colorectal cancer by 40%.

side effects.title: Effect of filler metals on the temperature sensitivity of side-hole fiber.
side effects.summary: The temperature sensitivity of side-hole fiber increases with the introduction of filler metals, especially those with larger thermal expansion coefficients.

dosage.title: A study on the efficiency of steel vs. synthetic vs. hybrid fibers on fracture behavior of concrete in flexure using acoustic emission
dosage.summary: Three different fiber dosages (0.50%, 0.75%, and 1.0%) were considered for optimizing the fracture behavior of concrete.

dosage.title: Research on mechanical characteristics, fractal dimension and internal structure of fiber reinforced concrete under uniaxial compression
dosage.summary: Fiber dosages in fiber-reinforced concrete range from 0% to 1.2 wt%, with 0.8 wt% glass fibers resulting in 39% higher peak stress than ordinary concrete.

dosage.title: Mechanical Properties of Macro Polypropylene Fibre-Reinforced Concrete
dosage.summary: Fiber dosages in this study were 4 kg/m3 and 6 kg/m3, with 6 kg/m3 increasing compressive, splitting tensile, and bonding strength compared to plain concrete.

dosage.title: The effect of fibre on gastrointestinal transit times in vegetarians and omnivores
dosage.summary: 15 or 40g of dietary fibre per day in vegetarians and omnivores did not affect gastric emptying or small intestinal transit times.

dosage.title: The hydrosoluble fiber Plantago ovata husk improves levodopa (with carbidopa) bioavailability after repeated administration
dosage.summary: Fiber was administered at 100 and 400 mg/kg doses, with higher final concentrations and slower elimination.

dosage.title: Influence of Fiber Addition on the Properties of High-Performance Concrete
dosage.summary: Fiber dosages of 15, 25, and 35 kg/m3 in high-performance fiber-reinforced concrete (HPFRC) affect compressive strength, modulus of elasticity, flexural, and splitting tensile strength.

dosage.title: Influence of Fiber Type and Dosage on Tensile Property of Asphalt Mixture Using Direct Tensile Test
dosage.summary: The optimum dosage of fiber in asphalt mixtures is 0.50 wt% for granular lignin fiber, 0.45 wt% for flocculent lignin fiber, and 0.50 wt% for basalt fiber.

dosage.title: Quantifying Computed Tomography of Basalt Fiber-Reinforced Concrete under Unconfined Compression
dosage.summary: The best fiber dosage for reinforced concrete is 3 kg/m3, as this significantly increases the peak stress to 44.4 MPa and reduces the proportion of macropores.

dosage.title: HYBRID FIBER REINFORCED CONCRETE
dosage.summary: Hybrid fiber concrete has a maximum fiber dosage of 0.75 Vol.%, with compressive strength varying between 55 and 65 MPa depending on the fiber mixture.

dosage.title: [Dietary fibre: more than a matter of dietetics. II. Preventative and therapeutic uses].
dosage.summary: Therapeutic dosages of dietary fiber preparations are 20-40 g/day and of purified fibers substances 10-20 g/day.
